get.description: Get details of all apps associated with an account.

parameters.description: Start date range in ISO-8601 UTC format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
parameters.name: date_start

parameters.description: Option to only return the record count. Options are ‘true’ or ‘false’. Defaults to false.
parameters.name: count

parameters.description: The number of records to limit the response to.
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Offset of the first record.
parameters.name: page_offset

parameters.description: End date range in ISO-8601 UTC format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
parameters.name: date_end

get.description: Get details of an existing application.

put.description: Modify an existing application (NOTE: whenever a PUT is performed, a new shared secret is created and returned).

get.description: Get details of all calls with filters for status and pagination.

parameters.description: Filter for status of call. Options are ‘in_progress’, ‘complete’, ‘all’. Defaults to ‘all’
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Start date range in ISO-8601 UTC format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
parameters.name: date_start

parameters.description: End date range in ISO-8601 UTC format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
parameters.name: date_end

parameters.description: Option to only return the record count. Options are ‘true’ or ‘false’. Defaults to false
parameters.name: count

parameters.description: The number of records to limit the response to. Defaults to 10
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Offset of the first record. Defaults to 0
parameters.name: page_offset

post.description: Make an outbound SIP or PSTN call

get.description: Get all recordings hosted by Nexmo.

parameters.description: Option to only return the record count. Options are ‘true’ or ‘false’. Defaults to false.
parameters.name: count

parameters.description: Start date range in ISO-8601 UTC format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
parameters.name: date_start

parameters.description: End date range in ISO-8601 UTC format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
parameters.name: date_end

parameters.description: Filter based on a specific call uuid
parameters.name: call_uuid

parameters.description: The number of records to limit the response to. Defaults to 10
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Offset of the first record. Defaults to 0
parameters.name: page_offset

get.description: Get details of a specific recording currently hosted by Nexmo.

delete.description: Hang up a current live call.

get.description: Get details of a specific call.

leg.description: Leg of the call to perform the action on. Options are ‘a_leg’, ‘b_leg’ or ‘both’. Defaults to ‘both’

orphan_action.description: What to do with orphan legs if ‘leg’ is not ‘both’. Options are ‘transfer’ or ‘hangup’. Defaults to ‘hangup’

orphan_method.description: HTTP method that is used to make the request. Defaults to POST

orphan_url.description: URL that gets called if orphan_action is ‘transfer’

transfer_method.description: HTTP method used to make the request. Defaults to POST

transfer_url.description: URL that gets called by transferred leg or call. Should return a Nexmo Call Control Object

post.description: Send DTMF to a live call or leg.

digits.description: Comma separated list of digits to send.

leg.description: Which part of the call to send TTS. Options are ‘a_leg’, ‘b_leg’ or ‘both’. Defaults to ‘both’

method.description: Whether to send DTMF inband or RFC2833. Options are ‘in’ for inband or ‘out’ for out of band. Defaults to ‘out’.

delete.description: Stop recording a call and return parameters to `event_url`.

post.description:
Start recording a call that is in progress and return parameters to `event_url` when the call ends.

URLS returning audio files support the following mime types:
- audio/wav
- audio/mpeg
- audio/ogg

delete.description: Stop streaming an audio file to a live call or call leg.

leg.description: Which part of the call to stream the audio file to. Options are ‘a_leg’, ‘b_leg’ or ‘both’. Defaults to ‘both’

level.description: Set the audio level of the stream. -1>=level=<1. Defaults to 0. Resolution is 0.1

loop.description: Whether to loop the stream once the stream ends. Options are an integer 0>=loop<10 where 0 loops continously. Defaults to 1.

stream_url.description: A comma separated list of audio URLs to stream.

post.description: Start streaming an audio file to a live call or call leg. Supported formats are mp3, wav and ogg.

leg.description: Which part of the call to stream the audio file to. Options are ‘a_leg’, ‘b_leg’ or ‘both’. Defaults to ‘both’

delete.description: Stop text to speech to a live call or call leg.

gender.description: The gender to use for TTS. Options are ‘male’ or ‘female’. Defaults to female

language.description: The language used to read the message. Defaults to "en-gb"

leg.description: Which part of the call to send TTS. Options are ‘a_leg’, ‘b_leg’ or ‘both’. Defaults to ‘both’

level.description: Set the audio level of the TTS. -1>=level=<1. Defaults to 0

loop.description: Whether to loop the once the TTS ends. Options are an integer 0>=loop<10 where 0 loops infinity or ‘false’. Defaults to ‘false’

text.description: Body of the text message. 0>text<1500. Commas control pauses in speech.

post.description: Start text to speech to a live call or call leg.

leg.description: Which part of the call to send TTS. Options are ‘a_leg’, ‘b_leg’ or ‘both’. Defaults to ‘both’

delete.description: Returns participants of a whisper back to the parent conference.

post.description: Allow two or more conference participants to speak off the record directly without other conference participants hearing them by creating a sub-conference. Whispers accept all conference API call’s. The `conference_uuid` returned is a child of the parent conference.

participants.description: An array of ‘call_uuid’’s to join a whisper.

put.description: Modify those participants in the the whisper subconference. Those excluded are returned to the parent conference.

participants.description: New array of ‘call_uuid’ to modify the whisper

get.description: Get a list of all the currently active conferences with pagination information.

parameters.description: Filter for status of call. Options are ‘in_progress’, ‘complete’, ‘all’. Defaults to ‘all’
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Start date range in ISO-8601 UTC format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
parameters.name: date_start

parameters.description: End date range in ISO-8601 UTC format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ
parameters.name: date_end

parameters.description: Option to only return the record count. Options are ‘true’ or ‘false’. Defaults to false
parameters.name: count

parameters.description: The number of records to limit the response to. Defaults to 10
parameters.name: page_size

parameters.description: Offset of the first record. Defaults to 0
parameters.name: page_offset

parameters.description: Filter for name conf name. Takes partial match with wildcard e.g. *mo, nex* etc.
parameters.name: name

get.description: Returns the details of an existing conference.
Returns all participants in an existing conference.

delete.description: Remove a participant from the conference.

get.description: Returns the details of an existing participant in an existing conference.

put.description: Perform RPC style actions on conference participants.

action.description:
The action to performed on a participant. Options are:
‘vol_up’ – Increase volume of participant
‘vol_down’ – Decrease volume of participant
‘mute’ – Mute participant
‘unmute’ – Unmute participant
‘earmuff_on’ – Prevent participant hearing conference
‘earmuff_off’ – Allow participant to hear conference again

delete.description: Stop streaming an audio file to a conference participant.

post.description: Stream an audio file to a conference participant.
Play TTS to a single conference participant only.

delete.description: Stop recording a call and return parameters to `event_url`.
Stop streaming an audio file to a conference.

leg.description: Which part of the call to stream the audio file to. Options are ‘a_leg’, ‘b_leg’ or ‘both’. Defaults to ‘both’

level.description: Set the audio level of the stream. -1>=level=<1. Defaults to 0. Resolution is 0.1

loop.description: Whether to loop the stream once the stream ends. Options are an integer 0>=loop<10 where 0 loops continuously. Defaults to 1.

stream_url.description: A comma separated list of audio URLs to stream.

post.description: Stream an audio file to a conference.
Play Text To Speech into a conference.

answer_method.description: HTTP method that is used to make the request. Defaults to POST.

answer_url.description: URL that gets called once a call is answered. The URL returns a NCCO.

backup_method.description: HTTP method that is used to make the request. Defaults to POST.

backup_url.description: Backup event URL in case primary is unavailable.

event_method.description: HTTP method that is used to make the request. Defaults to POST.

event_url.description: Asynchronous webhook that receives event information of a call.

numberpool_id.description: ID of number pool connected to the application.

from.description: An e.164 formatted number or a SIP URI.

answer_method.description: HTTP method that is used to make the request. Defaults to POST

answer_url.description: URL that gets called once a call is answered. The URL returns a NCCO

backup_method.description: HTTP method that is used to make the request. Defaults to POST

backup_url.description: Backup event URL in case primary is unavailable

dtmf_answer.description: Digits that are sent as soon as the call is answered (pauses are created using ‘p’ = 500ms & ‘*’, ‘#’ are respected)

event_method.description: HTTP method that is used to make the request. Defaults to POST

event_url.description: Asynchronous webhook that gets called each time one of the following call events are fired. The call states are:  ‘started’, ‘ringing’, answered,’busy’, ‘failed’, ‘timeout’, ‘cancelled’, ‘machine’, ‘complete’

from.description: An e.164 formatted number or a SIP URI.

length_timer.description: Timer in seconds that starts after a call moves to the ‘in_progress’ state. Call is dropped when it reaches 0. 0>=length_timer

machine_detection.description: How to behave if an answering machine is encountered. Options are ‘continue’ or ‘hangup’. If continue, event_url is called with param MACHINE.

machine_timeout.description: Machine detection analysis timeout in seconds. 2000>timeout<10000. Defaults to 5s

ringing_timer.description: Timer in seconds that starts after a call moves to the ‘ringing’ state. Call is dropped when it reaches 0. 0>=ringing_timer. Default is 60

sip_headers.description: Array of custom SIP headers to send in all SIP requests. Prefixed with ‘NX-’

to.description: Array of destinations in either e.164 format or a SIP URI. Multiple destinations (max 10). E.164 and SIP URI’s can be mixed and matched.

request_id.description: The unique ID of the API request

example.detail: The request cost exceeds your current ballance.
example.title: Out Of Credit

backup_method.description: HTTP method that is used to make the request. Defaults to POST

backup_url.description: Backup callback URL in case primary is unavailable

beep_finish.description: Whether to beep when the recording finishes. Options are ‘true’ or ‘false’. Defaults to false

beep_start.description: Whether to beep when the recording starts. Options are ‘true’ or ‘false’. Defaults to false

destination_url.description: Optional URL to record the recording to if it is not hosted by Nexmo. If omitted, the recording is hosted by Nexmo

event_method.description: HTTP method that is used to make the request. Defaults to POST

event_url.default: Asynchronous webook that gets called following a recording that returns the URL of the recording and other meta data

format.description: Format of the file. Options are ‘mp3’, ‘wav’ or ‘vorbis’. Defaults to ‘mp3’

public.description: Whether to require credentials to access the file or public. Options are ‘true’ or ‘false’. Defaults to ‘false’

streamed.description: If destination_url is specified, whether to stream the recording immediately or uploaded via a multipart form submission once the recording has finished. Options are ‘true’ or ‘false’. Defaults to ‘false’ (only valid if split is ‘false’)

validity_time.description: Time in minutes that the recording is valid for until it is deleted if hosted by Nexmo. 1>validity_time. Default is indefinite

backup_method.description: HTTP method that is used to make the request. Defaults to POST

backup_url.description: Backup callback URL in case primary is unavailable

beep_finish.description: Whether to beep when the recording finishes. Options are ‘true’ or ‘false’. Defaults to false

beep_start.description: Whether to beep when the recording starts. Options are ‘true’ or ‘false’. Defaults to false

destination_url.description: Optional URL to record the recording to if it is not hosted by Nexmo. If omitted, the recording is hosted by Nexmo

event_method.description: HTTP method that is used to make the request. Defaults to POST

event_url.default: Asynchronous webook that gets called following a recording that returns the URL of the recording and other meta data

format.description: Format of the file. Options are ‘mp3’, ‘wav’ or ‘vorbis’. Defaults to ‘mp3’

public.description: Whether to require credentials to access the file or public. Options are ‘true’ or ‘false’. Defaults to ‘false’

split.description: Whether to split the recording into two separate recordings per leg (prefixed with ‘a_’ or ‘b_’. Options are ‘true’ or ‘false’. Defaults to ‘false’

streamed.description: If destination_url is specified, whether to stream the recording immediately or uploaded via a multipart form submission once the recording has finished. Options are ‘true’ or ‘false’. Defaults to ‘false’ (only valid if split is ‘false’)

validity_time.description: Time in minutes that the recording is valid for until it is deleted if hosted by Nexmo. 1>validity_time. Default is indefinite

level.description: Set the audio level of the stream. -1>=level=<1. Defaults to 0. Resolution is 0.1

loop.description: Whether to loop the stream once the stream ends. Options are an integer 0>=loop<10 where 0 loops continously. Defaults to 1.

stream_url.description: A comma separated list of audio URLs to stream.

gender.description: The gender to use for TTS. Options are ‘male’ or ‘female’. Defaults to female

language.description: The language used to read the message. Defaults to "en-gb"

level.description: Set the audio level of the TTS. -1>=level=<1. Defaults to 0

loop.description: Whether to loop the once the TTS ends. Options are an integer 0>=loop<10 where 0 loops continously. Defaults to 1

text.description: Body of the text message. 0>text<1500. Commas control pauses in speech.
